title: Madetoja - Sym #3 - P Sakari, Iceland SO (1992) [Philidor; FLAC]
description:
Per Wikipedia, "Leevi Antti Madetoja (17 February 1887, Oulu â€“ 6 October 1947, Helsinki) was a Finnish composer, music critic, conductor, and teacher of the late-Romantic and early-modern periods, generally considered to be one of the most significant Finnish composers to emerge in the wake of Jean Sibelius, under whom he studied privately from 1908 to 1910."

Madetoja moved from Late Romanticism to Neo-Classicism, and was one of the first Scandinavian composers to do so. As such, he met with great resistance from critics and audiences in his final years, and definitely contributed to his growing reliance on alcohol. His Third Symphony dates from this period, around 1926. It's a pastoral, transparent, poised and dance-like work, which perplexed audiences at the time. As French writer Henri-Claude FantapiÃ© was to state years later, "The listeners expected the opera [The Ostrobothnians] to be followed by a nationalistic anthem, and were disappointed to hear something that seemed to them to be hermetic and that, to crown it all, was lacking in pomposity and solemnity." Today,  it is considered Madetoja's masterpiece, along with the haunting ballet, Okon Fuoko, about a magician's creations that come to life, killing their creator.


Transfers are made at 768 kBits/s, directly from the disc.

Bio enclosed. You can find all my classical uploads by searching on Philidor, or in this thread:
